article_title: U.S. Grows at 3.6% Pace in 3rd Quarter
article_text:
The U.S. economy expanded significantly faster than initially estimated in the third quarter as businesses fattened their inventories, a factor that is likely to weigh on growth in the year's final quarter.

Gross domestic product, the broadest measure of goods and services produced in the economy, grew at a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 3.6% from July through September, the Commerce Department said Thursday. The measure was...

twitter.description: The U.S. economy grew at a faster pace in the third quarter than initially thought, though underlying figures suggest slower growth in the final months of the year.
twitter.creator: @EricMorath

image.alt: That 3.6% growth in U.S. GDP? Not all it seems

twitter.title: Business Stockpiling Fuels 3.6% Growth Pace
